alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 24 at 4:38AM EST until January 25 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...In Florida, Escambia Coastal, Santa Rosa Coastal and Okaloosa Coastal Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, from 9 PM Tuesday to noon CST Wednesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from Tuesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf and rip current conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal
